{"step_by_step_thinking": "Diethyl stilbesterol (DES) is a synthetic nonsteroidal estrogen that was used to prevent miscarriages and premature births. However, it was found to cause several adverse effects in the offspring. Clear cell carcinoma, malformation of the vagina and uterus, and vaginal adenosis are all known complications associated with DES exposure in utero. However, microglandular hyperplasia is a benign condition of the cervix that is not associated with DES exposure.", "answer_choice": "B. Microglandular hyperplasia"}
